intro: Paracoffea brassii, commonly known as the African coffee tree, is a species native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that contain seeds used for coffee production. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and potential for coffee cultivation, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
